name: Outer Isles
role_in_state: maritime relay, ship-repair chain and buffer
economy_niches: transshipment of ritual reagents / augury waystations
culture_adjustments: stronger local guild autonomy vs. mainland civic councils
dialectal Coastal Tongues variant with island lexemes
ritual life keyed to immediate tide-storm cycles
maritime ancestor cults emphasize rock-line offerings
practical syncretism favors shipwright patron rites
constraints: limited arable land; food imports required
access windows constrained by seasonal weather
no large-scale combustion industry; craft-scale only
notes: key transshipment point for reagents and augury services
acts as strategic maritime buffer and pilot network
guild networks control most shoreside infrastructure
